Player History
Had first career hit on 5/19/1971, off Jim Lonborg (CHC)...
Hit first career homerun on 9/24/1971, off Bill Edgerton (CHC)...
Traded from St. Louis to Chicago (N) on 1/31/1972 (Going to STL: 1B M. Hargrove. Going to CHC: 2B P. Gagliano)...
Drafted in 4th round, 75th overall pick, by San Francisco in 1976...
Injured on 4/13/1977 with a Tender Elbow, out for one week...
Injured on 8/18/1981 with a Tight Shoulder, out for 5 days...
Released by San Francisco on 4/1/1984...
Drafted in 4th round, 69th overall pick, by New York (A) in 1987...
Injured on 5/21/1987 with a Torn Calf Muscle, out for 4 weeks...
Injured on 8/6/1989 with a Bruised Hand, out for 2 days...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1992, off Rod Beck (CLE)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/30/1992, off Rich Rodriguez (MIN)...
Injured on 7/31/1992 with a Bruised Ulna, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/7/1993, hitting .545 with 1 HR, 8 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/12/1994, hitting .636 with 1 HR, 6 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/1/1994, hitting .556 with 1 HR, 6 RBI...

Drove in 6 runs against Baltimore on 9/19/1995...

Drove in 6 runs against Boston on 7/25/1996...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1997...
